page.title: 05Landscape
page.content: The southern border of the block lies on the Limestone ridge which runs South-East from Lincoln, however 80% of the area lies on the flood plain of Witham much of it below the present level of the river. The predominate soil is a fen peat which provides top grade farmland. Farms are large arable concerns growing potatoes (Main crop) barley,wheat,peas,sugarbeet and rape. Irrigation of the potatoes ,peas and sugarbeet is becoming a familiar sight on the fen farms during the summer months. Industrial concerns are few only two employ more than 5 people. One of these is a light engineering company which specialises in making high grade equipment for the oil industry.
